title: This is why we can't ever have anything nice.
body:
I'm already getting frustrated and it hasn't even happened yet. Whenever the support or jungler's get something nice that's going to help out our role the other players come in and abuse the crap out of it until it gets nerfed. It happened with Sightstone, it happened with Spirit of the Elder Lizard,  and It's going to happen with Cinderhulk. Last night I had a ranked game where my support and top laner both went smite so they could go challenging smite Cinderhulk. Unfortunately it was amazing and we won.

This is the last thing I need. Can't we do something so only those roles that the item is meant for can use it? I'm just tired of getting to a place where I enjoy Support or Jungle then it gets nerfed to the point I hate the role again.

We put % bonus HP onto Cinderhulk because we wanted to address a discrepancy between jungle tanks and other junglers/laning tanks. Tanks that jungle tended to fall behind other junglers in terms of gold earned and on average were down noticeable experience and gold relative to laning tanks.  As a result we wanted to offer them, specifically, significant survivability that wasn't easily accessible to everyone else (they needed more help basically).

I believe that the aoe damage from cinderhulk is not the core problem with the smite top meta.

The current meta has shifted towards tanks mostly because their itemization has been buffed. On top of that, you provide an item augmenting the scaling of tank and reducing the incoming damage from one source is available at the expense of a summoner. In my opinion, Top laners pick cinderhulk for the +25% bonus hp not for the aoe damage.
Example : Hecarim. Dealing aoe damage is a bonus, but the added hp scaling and the reduced incoming damage allows him to jump in and assassinate a squishy target while being healthier than ever.

I have a proposition to counter that:
Make the bonus value scale with the number of big monster killed in the jungle. 
       Example : gain +0.5% of bonus hp of by big monster killed, up to 25% -50 big monster kills- 
With a nerf like this one you will need to be a full time jungler to unlock the full potential of the item. Moreover, if you really want to nerf the aoe, you can use a similar system.

TL;DR : make cinderhulk passive stack up with monster kills, up to the current value to nerf the item on top laners.

Can I make a suggestion? Why not make it work similarly to Seeker's Armguard/Devourer Enchantment? Cinderhulk is a problem because it's used by people outside of the jungler role, right? Well, make it so the bonus health isn't as good unless they're killing large monsters in the jungle. As you kill large monsters, Cinderhulk "levels up". Build the item and it starts at 10% bonus. Every one or two large monster(s) killed adds 3% until it hits 25% (I'm thinking two large monsters per "stack", since one would be too easy still and any more than two defers the power of the item too much for the jungler. Giving it a 10% baseline makes sure it has some semblance of gold efficiency early on). 

This makes it much more valuable for the jungler and far less appealing to the laner, as the power received from it is dependent on actually killing jungle camps. At the same time, it also slows down the overbearing, super tanks that are so strong right now while not nerfing the item into the ground, thus making them underpowered again. Additionally, it makes it something you COULD still use top, but in a very, very niche situation. I'm all for offbeat things not being completely ruined.
The AoE damage isn't the problem, though...it's the massive health boost.

Do you mean "Wow. That is so strong. O_O" amazing or "THIS IS STUPID!!! HOW DID THIS MAKE IT THROUGH BALANCE!!! D:<" amazing, because I haven't seen this, and if its the first one, I think this can safely be left alone.

First one. It's mostly annoying because Cinderhulk _will_ be receiving nerfs and like it or not, they _will_ be harsher than they would otherwise have been as a result of supports and top laners latching onto it. Nautilus and Hecarim, meanwhile, both of whom are traditionally junglers but neither of whom are oppressive in that role will both likely also be nerfed because of their recent lane success, pushing them into near complete non-viability in the jungle.

We're testing some Hecarim changes at the moment with the goal of reducing his laning power without hitting his jungling. What that currently looks like is an increased mana cost on his Q, so it's not quite as spammable in lane, but with the reduced damage to jungle monsters removed so his jungle clears don't get penalized. Still exploring and discussing options though of course, so those exact changes aren't guaranteed to happen.
Why isn't this on PBE? I thought that was supposed to be the "experimental" realm.
Because they also test internally before they let players test.  PBE isn't the sole testing grounds.

There's pretty much always a period between each patch when what's being tested internally and what's on the PBE is out of sync. Right now the PBE's being used for final bug testing on patch 5.8 for example. Internally though we're focused on developing changes for 5.9. Once 5.8's gone out the PBE will flip over to 5.9 as well.

For some changes we'll also do some early testing internally only before pushing stuff to PBE. That's most often used for things that are highly likely to fail (but should teach us something useful), stuff that's roughly implemented (bit buggy or placeholder visual effects) etc.

Hello Meddler - I hope you get this message - This is a topic that I really want to give direct input onto and I hope that you will take my input given whatever credit I can muster in terms of ranking.

I'm the rank 1,2 and 3 Hecarim player of the OCE server and played Hecarim to Challenger 4 times with 3 accounts in challenger by playing almost **Hecarim jungle exclusively** over the last 2 years, so I'm really passionate about **Hecarim jungle -** I was Diamond 1 on NA before OCE server existed (had 200 ping on NA) and I want to discuss with you the changes you want to make to Hecarim.

**I really think you're on the right track by trying to make changes that affect his laning and not his jungling - the idea you have in mind to change mana costs but remove the penalty to jungle Q damage sounds good.**

Some ideas that I want to give you to help reign the pony in to be a jungler and not an overbearing laner - would be to only change his Q and W to be less effective in lane and I'll explain how you can do that.

You can start with your proposed changes to your Q - but be extremely careful as to not touch it with heavy hands - it is very balanced of an ability as it stands now - I understand that increasing mana costs so Q cannot be used as much in lane seems to be the only solution and to me I agree with that - but depending on how badly you nerf the Q mana cost - don't give it too much damage bonus versus jungle monsters or else Hecarim's clear might become overpowered - so just be very careful as it is already ok as is. You might want to look into ways that jungle Hecarim can access more mana through outside of lane to ease the pain of a heavier Q mana cost.

As for Hecarim's W - the solution is simple. **If you can make the damage and healing both less effective on lane minions** but _then the same or slightly increased versus jungle monsters_ - then you can easily turn the pony back to where he belongs - a balanced jungler and not a top laner.

I'd be really happy if you could go through with any changes like these to tone down lane Hecarim so that people stop banning him as frequently so I can go back to jungling my Pony every game - he is one of the higher skill requiring junglers to play but a very easy braindead laner to play so I'm hopeful for where you will go with these changes.

Also lastly - if you could Fix the MASSIVE BUG with his E that has existed for more than a year and a half now I would be very grateful - I have made a youtube video of it here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jfqgpeZ-5DY I am happy to come back and go into detail how to trigger it if it means getting it fixed.

I eagerly hope you respond :)

IMO they just need to make sunfire appealing to laners. CInderhulk is just straight up better and gives you a low CD summoner spell and another farming option.

My solution would be to nerf Smite when out of jungle, using it on a champion would require both charges and it stops cooling down for 5 seconds if a minion dies within 600-800 range, but that can only happen once every 10 seconds greatly raising it's cooldown in lane without making it unusable,

So far at least we don't think there's a problem with Smite being picked on laners. There's a really interesting choice there in terms of giving up PVP power for PVE objective control power. There is a problem there however if one spell's the best choice for both PVP and for PVE, and it's looking possible that Challenging Smite is in that spot at the moment. We're going to give Skirmisher's Sabre a look this coming patch, see if it needs any adjustments as a result.

Honestly, I feel both Challenging and Chilling smites are running into issues. Challenging is a one button 'you lose this duel' and Chilling is a one button 'I catch you'. Sure, in teamfights they don't matter much, but early game they're really easy gank buttons.

Cinderhulk is the problem; not in itself, but how it compares to the alternative. It completely eclipses Sunfire Cape, which top lane bruisers build if they don't take Smite. Since they usually don't need Ignite, and some don't even need Flash, why not take Smite? It gives better objective control, and Cinderhulk has a much better Sunfire Cape built into it, on top of multiplying the effectiveness of all their other normal tanky items.

Skirmisher's Sabre and Challenging Smite being the Smite of choice for top laners is pure happenstance, because dueling is what top laners (and Rek'Sai) are already good at. Shyvana in particular is a premier duelist who can already function very well with only tanky items. Cinderhulk exacerbates her advantages.

Also, I have a somewhat related question to the effects Cinderhulk has had on tanks as a whole if you wouldn't mind answering.

What do you intend to do about tanks who are reaping Cinderhulk's benefits like a wheat farmer on cocaine? Gragas and Sejuani have become pick/ban thanks to their teamfight-changing CC to go with their newfound tankiness, but Volibear is a champion who feels like a serious problem just waiting to charge out and chew on everything like a squeaky toy if those two are banned. Chosen of the Storm heals him for significantly more than it used to, forcing mages into Morellonomicon and AD champions into Ignite just to deal with that, and he actually does *more* damage by stacking tons of health, which means he has even more survivability. Frenzy's base damage and bonus health scaling are very high on their own, and it's an execute to boot. With only Cinderhulk and Warmog's, he already deletes squishies who are unfortunate enough to be not even as low as half health.

With Righteous Glory (which he's guaranteed to get adjacent to Warmog's Armor) and Rolling Thunder—hell, throw a Randuin's Omen in there, too; another 500 HP and slow—you can't run away from him. Majestic Roar slows them for the last two basic attacks he needs, and he can already kill any squishy champion with virtually no counterplay to show for it.

League of Tanks has turned the game on its head (for better or worse), but it's made it nearly impossible to play anything squishy or immobile in solo queue.
